section.title: Rolling Reboot of the Cloud
section.para: If you have a planned maintenance and need to bring down your entire cloud and restart services while minimizing downtime, follow the steps here to safely restart your cloud. If you don't mind your services being down, then another option for planned maintenance can be found at .
To ensure that rebooted nodes reintegrate into the cluster, the key is having enough time between controller reboots.
The recommended way to achieve this is as follows:

listitem.para: Reboot controller nodes one-by-one with a suitable interval in between. If you alternate between controllers and compute nodes you will gain more time between the controller reboots.
Reboot of compute nodes (if present in your cloud).
Reboot of Swift nodes (if present in your cloud).
Reboot of VSA nodes (if present in your cloud)
Reboot of Ceph nodes (if present in your cloud).
Reboot of ESX nodes (if present in your cloud).
